com.marklogic.mgmt

Class AbstractResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marklogic.client.helper.LoggingObject
      • com.marklogic.mgmt.AbstractManager
        • com.marklogic.mgmt.AbstractResourceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlertActionManager, AlertConfigManager, AlertRuleManager, AmpManager, CertificateTemplateManager, ConfigManager, DatabaseManager, ExternalSecurityManager, ForestManager, GroupManager, MimetypeManager, PrivilegeManager, ProtectedCollectionsManager, RoleManager, ServerManager, TargetManager, TaskManager, TriggerManager, UserManager, ViewManager, ViewSchemaManager

    public abstract class AbstractResourceManager
extends AbstractManager
implements ResourceManager
    This class makes a number of assumptions in order to simplify the implementation of common operations for a MarkLogic management resource. Feel free to override the methods in here in a subclass when those assumptions don't work for a particular resource.

      • save

        public SaveReceipt save(java.lang.String payload)
        Determines whether to create a new resource or update an existing one based on the contents of the payload.
        Specified by:
        save in interface ResourceManager

      • encodeResourceId

        protected java.lang.String encodeResourceId(java.lang.String idValue)
        Mimetypes are likely to have a "+" in them, which the Management REST API won't support in a path - it needs to be encoded. Other resources could have a "+" in their ID value as well. However, doing a full encoding doesn't seem to be a great idea, as that will e.g. encode a forward slash in a mimetype as well, which will result in a 404.
        Parameters:
        idValue -
        Returns:

      • updateResource

        public SaveReceipt updateResource(java.lang.String payload,
                                  java.lang.String resourceId)
        Most clients should just use the save method, but this is public for scenarios where a client knows an update should be performed.

        Returns:
